There’s not wrong with being optimistic as long as it’s pragmatic.

e7sk6ob.Text:
This has to stop. No more waiting for logic to take hold and HOPE miners use Segwit. Humans are naturally illogical due to evolution. We all had to think different to capture the meat or else our species would go extinct. 
I agree with free will but not when it comes to coins! 

If someone wants to use non-Segwit, there is a coin for that. Bitcoin must put forth the best its devs have and if people don’t like the technology they are free to use the 1000’s of other alts. 
This community better come together again cause the greatest threat is coming when United next year.

e7rpqlq.Author: Neveragain646
e7rpqlq.Text:
Certain criteria must be met before a new bullrun occurs: 

* The stockmarket must crash
* There must be an economic recovery after a recession in order for people to look for new ways to invest
* There must be adoption of crypto into everyday life
* The milennium generation must obtain their degrees and enter the labormarket
* Goverments and institutions must adopt crypto to a certain degree
* Online companies like Google and Facebook must give full access to advertiement of cryptocompanies

This is going to take aprroximately 3 to 5 years. Bitcoin could rise to 20.000 again in 2022, which will make it a great investment if you invest now.

Basically, the whole thing is stupid. Roubini is stepping into water that he does not know how to navigate. He's been wrong about crypto every year and now that this year is bear market, he all of a sudden has credibility to talk blockchain, scaling, POW v POS etc?? It's ridiculous.

e7r8310.Author: MrRGnome
e7r8310.Text:
Know you aren't alone in feeling that way. Most of us have at some point or another been heavily in the red. If you haven't invested more than you can afford to lose you're fine. Grimace and tough it out. You signed up for 90% drops and 1000% gains when you got on this wild ride, don't pull out before you get to the good part if you can help it. Nine months is a pretty short time to be your own bank, we've had bear markets that last multiple years. I'd plan for several years, to the next halving at minimum.

If you have invested more than you can afford to lose reduce your position. It doesn't matter if the price rockets to 20k tomorrow if you can't afford to eat. Do what's best for you and yours and let bitcoin be a tool enabling that.

e7rvb3a.Author: elizabethgiovanni
e7rvb3a.Text: Facts. People falsely equate: everyone was talking about bitcoin to “everyone of those people bought crypto and got burned.” Imo, the last bull run put crypto in the mouths of the masses without 99% of them really understanding or thinking deeply about it. The next run will make those same people stop and actually think of the benefits and applications (I.e., bitcoin does not equal all cryptocurrencies, or also that crypto-“currency” is also not the sole purpose of all of these coins).

e7rzlnt.Author: Neveragain646
e7rzlnt.Text:
Of course there is evidence. Google search results tell you everything. Huge spike in december. It means new investors came in. Akmost all of them dropped out in december. This can only be average joe and not the crypto fanboy. 

Adoption as a payment method can only occur if btc loses its speculation value. It cannot be a speculative asset as well as a payment method. Would you want to buy a cup of coffee if the price could go up from 2 to 4 dollars in 20 seconds? It's either one or the other. If it becomes an adopted payment method, that means it would have lost its volatility and won't be interesting to make big profits. If it's still a speculative asset, it cannot become a payment method, thus it would be very difficult to be adopted by the mass (the mass doesn't like speculation - only a small part invests in stocks and gold). It means the price of 20.000 is extremely high and attaining that price again would be fantastic but very difficult, cause average joe doesn't come back so quickly to speculate a second time and get his ass burned again. We have seen it with .com companies. It took Microsoft 16 years to come back at ath. Same goes for other .com companies. The only difference is that Microsoft and Google already had VALUE. Google had a great search engine which displayed great utility. Microsoft had hotmail and other great products, which were used. Bitcoin? The question remains: what is the real value of it? Even after the .com bubble, Google had value, but we can't say the same about bitcoin and crypto. The only thing that has true value now, and even the biggest enemies of crypto acknowledge this (Roubini), is blochchain. But there's a difference between blockchain and crypto. It could well be that all crypto fails but blochcain survives. Remains institutions: institutions will never ever invest in crypto if high volatility remains. No big institution in the world is going to gamble with people's money (retirement funds, big banks). Way too risky and they're not interested in short term gains but long gradual gains. The stockmarket is ideal for them and poses way less risks. They have no incentive to enter crypto. If they'll enter, volatility would be very low and the time of big gains would be over. You have to think logical instead of being a fanboy.

e7s0s1e.Author: Neveragain646
e7s0s1e.Text: Fact 1: the mass doesn't like speculation. Only few of them invest in stocks, and even they are afraid of stocks losing value. The mass likes safety. Some of them invested in crypto, cause this time they couldn't resist (same as .com in 1999). There will never ever be mass adoption of crypto as a speculative asset. Never. Fact 2: bitcoin is either a speculative asset or a payment method. It cannot be both. You won't buy bread with a coin that can lose half of its value in one minute. If it remains a speculative asset, the price of 20.000 in december is extremely high. Going back to that price is going to be very very difficult, because you simply need average joe, who lost money on crypto and tends to not come back and doesn't like speculation. Fact 3: institutions won't invest in crypto as long as volatility is so high. Not a single institution is going to gamble with people's money (retirement funds, banks). Way too risky and governments won't allow it. If btc loses it's volatility and institutions step in, it cannot bring big gains anymore. This is pure logic. If you think about these things, the conclusion is very simple: it's going to be a hell of a job to get back at 20.000 and might take years or never happen. And by the way, what is wrong with btc attaining 20.000 in 2022. It's a fantastic ROI if you invest now.

The fundamentals have never been stronger and the market is maturing.Start buying now because in 6months to a year you will regret it.
